text: Shia LaBeouf is ready to talk. Nearly a year after being arrested in Savannah, Georgia, for public drunkenness and disorderly conduct, the 31 - year - old actor opened up about learning from his mistakes. “ What went on in Georgia was mortifying, ” LaBeouf recalled in his cover story for Esquire ’ s April 2018 issue. “ White privilege and desperation and disaster … It came from a place of self - centered delusion … It was me trying to absolve myself of guilt for getting arrested. I f – ked up. ” As previously reported, the Emmy winner was taken into police custody in July 2017 after resisting arrest and going on a racist, profanity - laced tirade.
